The form of sections of beams, joists, rails, etc., for which we considered the previous moments in the analysis, leads to the consideration of simple figures, since with practical proportions the flanges of these sections can be dealt with as rectangles of arbitrary width and height, creating a system of their own. Consequently, we shall find it convenient to draw the centroid of the C. G. of a number of sections involved.
Examples.—Find the centroid of the solid of the Tee section involved.
